Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is light-brown in section and contains many small white inclusions, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 8 wine for a sunshade shrine.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/162 The South Eastern Quarter of the North Suburb, House V.37.6
Curator's comments: Frankfort & Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 2:11, pl. LVIII, fig.21. Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3, plate LXXXVIII, N. 107. Wahlberg, The Wine Jars Speak, 113 n. 135
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393466) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393466)
